column5: Absolutely. A wise thing to say. The older we get the more memories we create, the more we also stand to lose. An external hard drive could be lost to fire or virus, our brains pretty muc h the same, but also time. It's good to look back often on happy days as well.Quote: Originally Posted by gordy28Thanks for taking the time to do the write up and to share it! As always really enjoyed it and felt like in a way I experienced a place I may never get to!Quote: Originally Posted by frozen fishA great story and amazing photos. Thank you for sharing your adventures.Thanks fellas. I'll be posting another big summer trip soon. You'll enjoy, it has everything!
Thank you very much for taking the time to not only photograph and document your incredible experiences, but to share them with us as well. It is VERY MUCH appreciated. SL
You gotta be one tough SOB in live up there. Nice story and photos as always.

During July while contracted to work in Coral Harbour, Nunavut, I was treated to six days out on the tundra fishing arctic char. With rather tempered expectations but high hopes, an unforgettable experience would quite exceed anything I could have imagined ahead of time. This is a heavy picture loaded story inspired from places atop Hudson Bay few will ever visit, written for the spirit of fishing adventure. Read on if you like...http://bunksoutdoorangle.com/a-nunav...ys-coral-char/Bunk.
Fantastic as always. Your stories almost transport me alongside for the adventure.
Great stuff! Fantastic landscape. Oh Canada!!!
Fantastic write up as always! Thanks for taking us with you on the adventure!
I look forward to your amazing photography an reports. The Arctic is so barren and yet beautiful. Great to see the char still abound, they are such an amazing colored species.
Hey fellas! Thanks for reading. Hard to not write and share these stories of incredible fish and places from the arctic. Will be looking for the next summer spot to visit while there over the winter.

Greetings,As we get older, more and more of us are finding that we spend a lot of time recalling memories. At least Moosebunk has some great memories to look forward to reliving when he gets older.Thanks for posting your story! Some of the pictures allowed me to recall some scenery from my trips to the Arctic.Kindest regards....
Thanks for taking the time to do the write up and to share it! As always really enjoyed it and felt like in a way I experienced a place I may never get to! Cheers Gordy
A great story and amazing photos. Thank you for sharing your adventures.
